raw_comment:
1) According to the graph I notice that out of the young adults who say they reach out to their parents every day or a few times a week, Young women tend to reach out to their parents more than young men. In the graph, young women tend to reach out 75% through text, more than 50% through phone/video chat, and a little more than 25% through in-person. In contrast, young men reach out less than 50% through text, less than 40% through phone/video chat, and less than 25% visit.
2) I wonder why it is that young women tend to reach out more than young men. Could it be due to the phase of independence? Could a factor be the relationships with parents and young adults? How does the female and male persona tend to affect this result?
3) This relates to my community and me because many are already in the young adult stage and in addition those are getting to the young adult stage who seem to be eager to explore their waiting and start to find their careers, earn money, and in general figure out the path ahead of them. 
4) Young Adults and Their Astonishing Levels of Involvement With Parents!
ace_sentences: The graph shows young adults who reach out to their parents every day or a few times a week.
Young women reach out to their parents more than young men.
About 75% of young women reach out through text.
More than 50% of young women reach out through phone or video chat.
More than 25% of young women reach out in person.
Less than 50% of young men reach out through text.
Less than 40% of young men reach out through phone or video chat.
Less than 25% of young men reach out in person.
I wonder why young women reach out more than young men.
A possible reason is a phase of independence.
Another possible reason is the relationship between parents and young adults.
I wonder how a female persona and a male persona affect this result.
This topic relates to my community.
Many people in my community are young adults.
Some people in my community will become young adults soon.
These people want to explore their future.
These people want to start their careers.
These people want to earn money.
These people want to find their path ahead.
The headline is: Young adults and their astonishing levels of involvement with parents.
